action->Exorcism Vulnerability.description:
If an invidiak attempts to possess a creature and the creature rolls a critical success on its saving throw to resist @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession}, or if an invidiak's possession of a creature is ended prematurely, such as via a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}, the invidiak takes @Damage[9d6[mental]] damage and cannot use possession for 24 hours.

See Iravalinn's Fight for Control reaction.

action->Share Pain.name: Share Pain
action->Share Pain.description:
Aktywator A creature within 30 feet of the invidiak deals damage to the invidiak

Efekt An echo of the invidiak's pain lashes out at the triggering creature, dealing an amount of nonlethal mental damage equal to half the damage the invidiak took from the triggering attack (@Check[will|dc:33|basic] save). On a critical failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1}.

action->Favored Host.name: Favored Host
action->Favored Host.description:
Vixivax's favored hosts are elves.

Each invidiak has a type of creature they prefer possessing, chosen from aberration, animal, beast, or any humanoid (such as dwarf, elf, or human) — in most cases, the favored type of target is human. When an invidiak casts possession on a favored host, the duration of possession increases to unlimited, and the effect lasts until dispelled or until the invidiak dismisses it.

action->Shadow Blend.name: Shadow Blend
action->Shadow Blend.description: The invidiak Strides up to twice their speed. If the invidiak ends their movement in an area of dim light, they become hidden as long as they don't move and the lighting in the area they're in doesn't grow brighter than dim light.

action->Unbodied Possession.name: Unbodied Possession
action->Unbodied Possession.description: Vixivax leaves no body behind when using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession}.

Withermold.name: Withermold
Withermold.description: Coils of pale yellow thorny fungal vines on which grow hundreds of brown puffballs suddenly whip into frenzied life.
Withermold.disable: @Check[religion|dc:33] (master) twice to exorcise the unholy presence within the withermold, or @Check[survival|dc:35] (master) twice to safely remove the sensory tendrils growing in the mold
Withermold.reset: A withermold deactivates at the end of any round when there are no targets within reach to attack with thorny vine Strikes. It resets immediately unless it's used all its Spore Burst reactions for the day, in which case the withermold resets in 24 hours.
Withermold.routine: (3 actions) A withermold makes three Strikes with its thorny vines on its turn, splitting its Strikes up among potential targets before striking a single target more than once.
Withermold.stealth: (master) (or +30 and expert if a PC critically succeeded at Recalling Knowledge about the campsite's condition)

action->Spore Burst.name: Spore Burst
action->Spore Burst.description:
Częstotliwość three times per day

Aktywator A Small or larger creature touches or attempts to enter one of the three tents

Efekt The thorny vines of the three withermolds growing on the tents suddenly whip into a frenzy, filling the air with clouds of toxic spores. All creatures within a tent or within 10 feet of a tent's exterior take @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic] save). The withermolds then roll initiative.

Zauglagaul.name: Zauglagaul
Zauglagaul.publicNotes:
The magic that flows through primal dragons can manifest more animalistic or bestial features in a given type of dragon. Notably among these are the massive paired horns of the horned dragon. While their bulky frames, natural coloration, and prominent ridged scales are all remarkable in their own way, it's the horns that are most obvious and striking at first glance. Horned dragons use their horns to impale their prey in a quick and brutal display of their might. They are generally contemplative and have a fixation on knowledge and self-discipline, traits belied by their bestial appearance. As a result, horned dragons are generally more open to speaking with outsiders.

Dragons come in myriad forms, with many having magical abilities or connections to magic. Some dragons draw greater power from magic than others, allowing them to manifest abilities or alter their physiques with prolonged exposure to magic. These dragons become more powerful as they age and strengthen their connections with their magical origins. Scholars debate the classification of these dragons, with some preferring the name magical dragons and others using traditional dragons due to their connection to specific magical traditions. Regardless of their names, these dragons share a number of characteristics: their ability to tap into magical energies, intensified might and cunning as they grow older, and an inclination to hoard vast amounts of treasure and wealth.
Zauglagaul.saveDetails: +1 status to all saves vs. primal

action->Camouflage.name: Camouflage
action->Camouflage.description: Zauglagaul can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} in exterior locations in Tanglebriar even if he doesn't have cover.

action->Mist Vision.name: Mist Vision
action->Mist Vision.description: Mist and fog (such as the Haze) doesn't impair Zauglagaul's vision; he ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty} condition from mist and fog.

action->Miasma.name: Miasma
action->Miasma.description:
20 feet. After the dragon uses their Poison Breath, a cloud of poison gas continues to emanate from their body for 1 round. Any creature that ends its turn in the miasma takes @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:39|basic] save).

Any creature in the miasma is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty} and treats other creatures as concealed. The dragon can see through this concealment.

action->Old Wound.name: Old Wound
action->Old Wound.description: After Zuldanavox nearly bit off Zauglagaul's right wing decades ago, it never quite healed right. A crescent-shaped patch of discolored scales at the base of his wing on his right side marks this wound. The PCs might already know about this wound (see Zauglagaul at a Disadvantage below); otherwise, a PC only learns about this weakness if they witness a critical hit against Zauglagaul that inflicts piercing damage. Once a PC knows about Zauglagaul's old wound, they can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} during their turn to focus on this old wound, automatically treating Zauglagaul as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} until the start of their next turn. If a PC critically hits Zauglagaul in the same round they Seek in this way, the pain causes the dragon to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Niezdarny 1} for 1 hour. Multiple critical hits can increase the value of these conditions up to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 4} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Niezdarny 4}.

action->Twisting Tail.name: Twisting Tail
action->Twisting Tail.description:
Aktywator A creature within reach of the dragon's tail uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using

Efekt The dragon makes a tail Strike at the creature with a –2 penalty. If the Strike hits, the dragon disrupts the creature's action.

action->Forest Passage.name: Forest Passage
action->Forest Passage.description: The horned dragon ignores any difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth. Even plants manipulated by magic don't impede their progress.

action->Impaling Charge.name: Impaling Charge
action->Impaling Charge.description:
Wymagania The dragon doesn't have a creature impaled on their horn

Efekt The dragon attempts to gore a foe. They Stride, then attempt a horn Strike. On a hit, the target becomes impaled on the dragon's horn. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} while on the horn (and can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} as normal). The dragon doesn't need to use additional actions to keep the impaled creature grabbed. If the dragon moves, they bring the grabbed creature along with them.

action->Spore Breath.name: Spore Breath
action->Spore Breath.description:
Zauglagaul breathes a toxic cloud of spores that deals @Damage[18d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:60]. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save. Zauglagaul can't use Spore Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Spore Breath]]{1k4 rounds}.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature takes no damage.

Sukces The creature takes half damage.

Porażka The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 1} for an unlimited duration as the spores take root and cause the victim to suffer from distracting hallucinations.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 2} for an unlimited duration.

action->Trackless Journey.name: Trackless Journey
action->Trackless Journey.description: The horned dragon always gains the benefits of Cover Tracks in natural surroundings, even while moving at full speed.
